summary:
General:
Mr Lodewijk de Groote has a Masters Degree in Economics and is specialized in regional and developing economy and transport economy. He has experience in developing countries since 1996 and has worked in Africa, Asia, the Caribbean and Europe for amongst others the African Development Bank, Asianb Development Bank, EBRD, European Commission, MCC and the World Bank. 

Economist expertise:
Mr. de Groote has been involved in feasibility studies in the transport, urban and water sector, transport modelling, development of cost models for infrastructure projects, statistical analysis, socio-economic surveys, road condition surveys, traffic surveys, financial and economic analysis of projects, risk and sensitivity analysis, financial auditing, logistics/production planning.
He has worked with HDM-4, RED, SPSS (statistical analysis software) and COSTAB used by the World Bank and the Asian Development Bank.

Project management/project acquisition:
From 1993 to 2009 Mr. de Groote has been involved in project acquisition working for DHV Consultants BV’s infrastructure department. Having more than 15 years of experience in the project acquisition cycle has allowed Mr. de Groote to gain a thorough understanding of all stages of project acquisition. Activities included selection of IFI procurement notices, producing expressions of interest and pre-qualification documents, writing and updating of project references, updating brochures and other promotional materials, liaising with partners, preparation of tenders (technical and financial) selection of expert CV’s and negotiating fees. 
Since 2009 He has been involved in project management for Safege’s overseas IFI projects. Activities performed include liaising with team leaders and clients, preparation of contract addenda / administrative orders / project budgets, preparation of tenders (technical and financial), selection of expert CV’s and negotiating fees, introduction of a staff planning system.

Specialties: HDM-4, cost-benefit analyses, socio-economic survey, multi-criterion analyses

Project description: The overall objective of the project is to make an overall independent assessment about the past performance of the INSTAP programme, paying particularly attention to the impact of the project actions against its objectives and to identify key lessons and propose practical recommendations for follow-up actions in particular for the technical assistance contract. The specific objectives of the project were to assess the program against the OECD-DAC evaluation criteria (Relevance, Effectiveness, Efficiency, Impact and Sustainability) and in addition coherence and cross-cutting issues.

Tasks: 
• Literature review of project documents;
• Consultation meetings with the key organizations;
• Conducting interviews with former technical assistance contractors and experts;
• Fact finding and data collection;
• Assessment of a significant sample of the supplies purchased under the programme, their conditions and the extent to which they are currently being utilised;
• Preparation of reports according to the ToR.

Financing: European Commission.

Position: Transport economist / HDM-4 expert with Egis-BCEOM.

Project description: Undertake preparatory activities for additional financing of the on-going National Highways Sector Project (NHSP ADB Loan 2177) and the Northern Road Connectivity Project (NRCP ADB Loan 2639). 

Tasks: 
• Update economic internal rate of return (EIRR) of 12 roads covering 314 km of national roads using HDM-4;
• Calculate EIRR of 14 roads covering 288 km under NHSP financing using HDM-4;
• Update overall EIRR of national roads under original financing and additional financing combined for both NRCP and NHSP;
• Calculate EIRR for road packages;
• Conduct sensitivity analysis for all individual roads and for all roads combined (IRR and NPV sensitivity indicators and switching values);
• Prepare a design and monitoring framework (DMF) according to the ADB guidelines (July 2007 edition);
• Writing of the economic chapters for the final reports.

Client: Asian Development Bank.', 'title': 'Road Project Preparatory Facility - Feasibility & Det. Amfors has an annual turnover of more than € 50 million and is based in Amersfoort, The Netherlands. As a consequence of the current economic situation, the company wants to investigate options to cut costs and has charged me with this task.

In order to achieve this the following initiatives have been / will be taken:
•	Analysis of the company’s creditors and debtors list
•	Drafting of a new classification of creditors and cut down the list from approximately 4 000 to approximately 400 preferred suppliers
•	Achieve savings in administration by reduction of the number of invoices from around 30 000 annually currently by signing framework contracts with preferred suppliers and by grouping invoices. 

Internal audit
Besides the above, I am also tasked to perform an internal audit for the human resources department of Amfors.
